lead_paragraph: To the Editor: "Accepting the Harsh Truth of a Blue-Collar Recession" (front page, Dec. 25), on the loss of more than one million blue-collar jobs in the current recession, correctly points out that not all of those jobs will return after the recession is over. While some have been lost because of increased efficiency, many are non- and low-skill manufacturing jobs. Where have those jobs gone?
